newsitem.title: USA: FCOJ futures close lower, focus on nearby spread.
newsitem.headline: FCOJ futures close lower, focus on nearby spread.

text.p: FCOJ futures closed lower for the third consecutive session as speculators continued to roll long March positions into May ahead of first notice day Monday, analysts said.
The nearby spread narrowed to 2.70 cents from 3.05 cents. Open interest, meantime, fell 1,160 lots to 3,830 lots in March from the previous close.
May ended down 1.20 cents to 79.10 cents per lb, having ranged from 80.10 to 78.60 cents. Spot March settled 0.85 lower at 76.40 cents.
Volume was estimated at a brisk 6,300 lots compared with Thursday's official volume of 5,004 lots.
High inventory and sluggish weekly movement coupled with a negative fundamental picture, could keep the market under considerable near-term pressure, analysts said.
Thursday, the Florida Citrus Processors Association put inventory at 147.314 million gallons and weekly movement at 4.946 million gallons, for the week ended February 22.
Support was seen between 74.00 cents and 72.00 cents in March. "There will be more buying interest (in March) if the market gets below that level," an analyst said.
May's downside target was pegged at 77.00 cents, with eventual support seen at 66.00 cents in May based on Elliott Wave theory.
